main event: A silvery spherical object, about the size of a baseball at arm's length, was observed moving from north to west for about 4 minutes near Paso Robles, California on August 29-30, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 35 seconds.
The object was observed spinning slowly, moving slowly from north to west.
The observer's attention was diverted from the object.
The observation was made by a 17-year-old civilian named Jerry Harding.
The report was considered fairly reliable by the GOC squadron, despite some previous 'prankish' reports from the same post.
